page.title: 11Uses of Ponds & Waterways.
page.content: The Pond in the centre of the village Plain is a main feature of Goudhurst. The beautiful beech and horse chestnut trees provide shade to visitors and locals who like to sit on the seats and watch the ducks. In 1965 the Pond sprung a leak and had to be drained and the fault remedied. Over the area there are many ponds marked on maps, some relics of the iron working, known as hammer ponds. Unfortunately when we came to survey the area some of these have been lost due to silting through lack of use or to progressive farming. Before mains water these ponds were a useful source for watering farm animals. There are several small rivers tributaries of the River Teise, which traverse the area. They are of use for irrigation and some coarse fishing.
